intro: Ipomoea classeniana, commonly known as the "Blue Moon" morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ipomoea classeniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
